Bendplane Fitter Software Tutorial

Step 1: Checking things out of CVS and running setup_dirs.pl

  • Make yourself a clean working directory on one of the PHENIX data disks. Note: if you build under the /direct/phenix+u/ directory you will quickly run into the 2GB disk quota.
    •   rcas2067 % pwd
  /phenix/data07/kelly/
  rcas2067 % mkdir sandbox
  rcas2067 % cd sandbox
  • Get an AFS token 
      rcas2067 % klog
  Password:  [enter you AFS password]
  • Checkout the mutoo package from the CVS repository 
      rcas2067% cvs co -d mutoo offline/packages/mutoo
  • Run the setup script 
      rcas2067% cd mutoo
  rcas2067% ./setup_dirs.pl
    The setup script will setup build and install directories for the various event loops that one might want to run. Steering scripts for various event loops are copied from the mutoo directory to the approriate run directories and automake is run for both the preco and mutoo packages so one can build local version of these packages. After the setup script is finished the directory below mutoo looks like the following. 
      rcas2067% cd ../
  rcas2067% ls
  mutoo mutoo_b mutoo_i prdf_to_dst preco_b preco_r preco_s

Step 2: Running the Beamplane event loop

  • Change your working directory to the mutoo/analysis/bend_plane directory and run the Makefile to generate some required libraries. 
    rcas2067% cd mutoo/analysis/bend_plane
rcas2067% make
  • Now just run the steering script. 
    rcas2067% root -b -q run_ana.C
    There should now be two default output files generated in the current working directory, mutoo_ntuple.root and dst_out.root.

    Step 3: Modifying the Code

  • The steering scripts, run_ana.C and run_one.C, are the highest level of control. To modify the next level of running, i.e. the modules that are run or the the ntuples generated, bend_plane.cxx is the place to go.
  • To modify the bendplane module, module parameter file, and header directly, go to modules directory: 
    rcas2067% cd ../../modules
rcas2067% ls mMutBendPlnFit*
    If any modifications are made, the mutoo libraries must be recompiled to include them. 
    rcas2067% cd ../../mutoo_b
rcas2067% make
rcas2067% make install
